column4: which encryption is used if you choose to encript the home directory when you install Ubuntu 10.10 ??
AES-256, I believe
The same encryption the US government uses to encrypt sensitive data
where can i check which encryption is used for encripted home directory?
It's AES-256
No, sorry, AES-128
are you sure, where did you get that info?
got a link that tells that?
I checked my encrypted home dir and it says cipher is AES, key bytes is 16. 16 bytes is 128 bits, so it's AES-128
is AES-128 the strongest cipher or is it AES-256?
I think you can go as high as you want with the number, but most people stop at AES-256
so AES-256 is stronger encryption than AES-128?
Yes
I have no idea. I've heard about the attack, but don't know the details
why can you attack the stronger encriptions, i.e. AES-192 and AES-256, but you cannot attack the weaker AES-128  ?
so is using EAS-128 better than AES-192 or AES-256then?
That's interesting...
Even with that, breaking the encryption is still infeasable though
i would like to know why AES-128 is not affected by the related-key attack
Well, for starters, these are two seperate attacks. One for 256 and one for 128
It looks like because the block size of AES is only 128, you can get more information from multiple block from the cipher?
Idk, I'm not a cryptographer, lol
i asked in crypto
